newsitem.title: FRANCE: SGS-Thomson sees semiconductor mkt up 6 pct.
newsitem.headline: SGS-Thomson sees semiconductor mkt up 6 pct.

text.p: SGS-Thomson Microelectronics NV market research director Jean-Philippe Dauvin said on Friday he reduced his 1997 forecast for the world semiconductor market to six percent growth from a previous forecast of 7.4 percent growth.

Dauvin, currently chairman of the World Semiconductor Trade Statistics (WSTS) organisation, said his company's forecast was higher than the 4.6 percent 1997 consensus growth forecast by the WSTS organisation.
Dauvin said he expected an end to the semiconductor industry's overcapacity in the third quarter of 1997 but overcapacity would remain for D-ram.
Dauvin maintained his forecast for a global market in the year 2000 of $300 billion which compares with $132 billion in 1996.
